pros: Flexibility Focus on diversity Great opportunities in addition to teaching
cons: Small campus, which has both pros/cons

review_title: Policies & Protocol not followed by upper management
pros: There is a lot of flexibility in the work schedule.
cons: Everyone is not held to the same standards and there is no consistency in oversight of policies and procedures by management.

review_title: Good benefit, good company to retire from
pros: People are friendly, alot of caring faculty and staff. Very understanding and accommodating when life happens. Great place to start a family.
cons: The college is a bit chaotic at organizing. The college has a unique work culture. You either fit in or you don't.

review_title: Working at a Psych Graduate School
pros: The people that work here are great. There is a racial healing course put on by the DEI director.
cons: Not close to any public transportation

pros: Great work life balance. Commitment to DEI. Lots of talented people.
cons: Higher than expected turnover and more open positions than ideal.

pros: Highly supportive community; faculty that are deep experts in their field; continuous innovation
cons: None at this time; exceptional experience

job_title: Resource and Referral Counselor in Newton, MA
pros:
- 35 hour work week
- supervision support for licensure
- 1 hour lunch
- extensive training at your own speed
- 12 paid holidays with some bonus days depending on when the holiday falls during the week
- decent benefits with great pay
- welcoming and helpful colleagues
- Team Leaders are available when supervisors are busy
- nice campus
- after working there for at least 3 years you can take classes for half off
- clean and modern look 
- there are maintained Charles River walking paths that are accessible from campus grounds
- ease of use with Ring Central and the online database
- access to IT is convenient
cons:
- not much opportunity for direct hours for licensure
- small campus - only one building
- no matching for retirement savings
- no continuing education reimbursement
- no part-time late night classes so if you wanted to be a student you'd either have to quit or become a part-time employee
- not much cultural diversity
- if you want cafeteria prices for food you need to go down the street to the Wells Cafe
- because INTERFACE is located inside William James College, most people get confused about what we do
- management is not always on the same page on whether we can serve a caller
- barely any room for advancement

pros: Supportive environment. Diversity of thought an disciplines. Room to experiment and grow.
cons: Not enough scaffolding for developing new professors. No teach and learning department. Lots of room to experiment but it's sink or swim.

pros: People work there were super nice.
